node.title: "Everything is gone": Destructive tornadoes, storms tear through South
node.description: More than 100,000 homes and businesses are without power.â€‹
node.content: ["A group of tornadoes and heavy winds are causing more destruction to the South. Several people were hurt, but no deaths have been reported. More than 100,000 homes and businesses are\u00a0without power.\u00a0", "Near Gulfport, Mississippi, debris littered neighborhoods after a tornado touched down there.", "\"The whole house was shaking you could just hear ripping apart and we came and saw everything is gone,\" a Gulfport resident told CBS News.\u00a0", "The National Weather Service issued tornado watches and warnings for several southern states, including portions of the Florida Panhandle, which was in the path of severe weather.\u00a0", "Strong and gusty winds near Mobile, Alabama, left a trail of damaged buildings.", "In Arkansas, the Springdale School District said an elementary school building's roof was destroyed when an\u00a0EF-3 tornado hit the area.", "South of Shreveport, a tree crashed through a home \u2014 missing a sleeping baby by inches.\u00a0", "\"It was just like a loud train like right close to you,\" one woman described.\u00a0", "The widespread damaging wind gusts and several intense tornadoes\u00a0hit the same areas\u00a0that were already recovering from a storm system that struck the area last week.", "Meteorologist Jim Cantore of The Weather Channel told \"CBS Mornings\" that the storm that hit the South is moving toward parts of the East Coast. High winds, tornadoes and severe thunderstorms are possible for the area."]
